messages.message:
For updating/publishing the app, the default selections are to:
• Publish a major version of the app (instead of minor/patch)
• Publish to production (instead of pre-production)
Do we set the defaults to be the highest precedent intentionally? If not, please can we set the defaults to be:
• Publish patch (so that users have to explicitly opt into publishing a major or even minor version)
• Publish to pre-production (so users have to explicitly opt into publishing to production)

@Ben Hope could you create a feature request with more context on the app versioning defaults? That would help us review it in the backlog for future prioritization.

Regarding the production vs. pre-production default, we're updating the terminology and simplifying the process for sharing apps within an organization as part of the new Apps UX. Since we recently reviewed the terminology and visibility defaults, we’d like to keep them stable for now to gather more customer feedback - but we’re definitely open to adjusting defaults in the future.
Will do - thanks for the additional context, that makes sense
